body_html:
This is working as intended, based on https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/data_versions#backward_and_partial_forward_compatibility

Forwards compatibility only really exists for patch releases; if you want forwards compatibility beyond that, there's more work you have to do (typically, it involves graph rewriting). Some of the utilities in graph_def_util.h are precisely meant for this:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/graph_def_util.h

Line 88 in 799e31f

Status RemoveNewDefaultAttrsFromGraphDef(
, but unfortunately the user has to deal with this.

(Reminder: You can't have both infinite forwards compatibility and infinite backwards compatibility without that meaning nothing ever changes :)).

body:
This is working as intended, based on https://www.tensorflow.org/programmers_guide/data_versions#backward_and_partial_forward_compatibility

Forwards compatibility only really exists for patch releases; if you want forwards compatibility beyond that, there's more work you have to do (typically, it involves graph rewriting).  Some of the utilities in graph_def_util.h are precisely meant for this: https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/799e31f3840c21322e380e1ec6e5bacb95d016fa/tensorflow/core/framework/graph_def_util.h#L88, but unfortunately the user has to deal with this.

(Reminder: You can't have both infinite forwards compatibility and infinite backwards compatibility without that meaning nothing ever changes :)).
